facts: Noah’s Ark is described as a huge wooden boat built to keep Noah’s family and pairs of animals safe during a great flood.
The Ark of the Covenant was a sacred gold-covered chest that held the stone tablets of the Ten Commandments.
A shepherd’s sling, like the one David used against Goliath, could fling a stone with surprising speed and power.
The menorah in the tabernacle was a seven-branched gold lampstand that symbolized light and worship.
The tabernacle was a portable tent sanctuary the Israelites carried through the wilderness as a place to meet God.
A shofar is a trumpet made from a ram’s horn that was blown for special events like festivals or calls to gather.
The crown of thorns placed on Jesus was meant to mock him as “king,” even though he taught about a different kind of kingdom.
sources_hint: Examples can be found in Genesis, Exodus, 1 Samuel, and the Gospels (Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John).
